alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued October 09 at 9:41PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE THIS WEEK... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan. A developing monsoon trough and moderate surge combined with a weak tropical disturbance is likely to bring locally heavy rain to the Marianas at times this week. A monsoon trough is in place across the Marianas, with east winds over Tinian and Saipan and southwest to west winds for Guam and Rota. The monsoon trough is expected to move little through Monday night, then drift northward as weak circulations develop and move west-northwestward, pulling the trough with them. In addition, a modest monsoon surge is expected over the region, resulting in increasing rainfall potential. This surge appears likely to maintain periods of moderate to heavy showers across the Marianas through most of this week. Latest model guidance indicates that rainfall through Friday may exceed 6 inches at one or more of the islands. The situation looks favorable for locally heavy rainfall capable of producing flash flooding across the Marianas. Closely watch this developing situation as watches, advisories or warnings may be issued at any point during the week. If you live near a stream or river, be prepared to move away to higher ground. Make sure storm drains nearby are not clogged. This outlook will be updated over the next few days with additional information, or cancelled if the situation changes.
